intro: Cosmos scabiosoides var. typicus, commonly known as the common cosmos, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, which bloom in summer. The plant has feathery, gray-green leaves and grows in a bushy form. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Cosmos scabiosoides var. typicus is a hardy perennial that prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
